intro: Afrachneria ecklonii, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces pods that contain edible seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal and sandy environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
